intro: Cuphea ligustrina var. silenoides, commonly known as the silverleaf cuphea, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It is characterized by its distinctive silver-gray foliage and clusters of tubular, red or pink flowers. The plant belongs to the Lythraceae family and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. The flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, making it a valuable addition to gardens.
